description: From Latin inspectum, past participle of inspicere (“to look into”), from in (“in”) + spicere (“to look at”), equivalent to in- +‎ -spect.

verbs.description: inspect (third-person singular simple present inspects, present participle inspecting, simple past and past participle inspected)

entries.meaning: To examine critically or carefully; especially, to search out problems or determine condition; to scrutinize.

examples: The general inspected the troops and their barracks.
